The last film I watched was "Señor dame paciencia". It's a Spanish comedy. It talks about the story of a family, in which the mother dies and the father has to take her role. His children are adults but they have personalities and likes that he does not like, for example, his son is gay and he hates that. They go on a family trip and things happen there until they obviously respect and love each other again.

The last movie I watched was It chapter 2. In this movie a group of childhood friends (now grown ups) have to go back to their hometown to kill a killer clown who terrorised them when they were kids. It's very interesting to see how the kids have changed and how their friendship never really disappeared. It seems like it's going to be just another horror films but it actually focuses on the values of friendship and how you can friends can be like a second family

The last film I've seen was about an American girl who travel to Europe with one of her friends to visit some of the main cities. Their first stop was Paris. There, they know a guy in the airport that takes them to their apartment. After an hour, several men with guns enter the apartment and kidnap them. The girl calls her father while she is hiding, but she is finally catch. The father shows to be a spice and, immediately, flies to France to rescue her daughter. The film develops showing the journey the father goes through to save his daughter.

The last movie i watched was “The Troll Hunter”, a Norwegian produced and directed film in which a group of journalism students. They are doing a filmed documentary about Norwegian landscape when, all of a sudden, they discover a bizarre man in a ban, and they start following him wherever he goes. The man tell the students that even he says he works as a plague controller, he’s indeed the one who holds off all the trolls over the Scandinavian countries. The film is a false documentary where the students are filming the hunter’s methods and instruments, and they film how the trolls behave in a natural environment, something the Government has tried to hide from the public eye. It’s a very interesting take on a “false documentary” with good 3D animation, and a really unique way to represent the Scandinavian and, more specifically, the Norwegian mythology.

The Interview' narrates the environment of South Korea under the dictatorship of Kim. Throughout the work of the two protagonists, who are going to interview he great leader, the dictator Kim will be exposed in front of a million viewers of a Television Interview as an evil person who manipulates information around the world, who threats the welfare of his own country and the peace in the rest of the world.

The Greatest Showman is the last film I have watched recently. It is about an unemployed man who decided to inaugurate a museum of waxen figures with the help of a loan bank. However, this museum was not so successful and he decided to change his show.
He inaugurated a circus with strange people such as a bearded lady.
This show became very successful but the protagonist became obsessed with money and fame, so he abandoned the people that performed in his show and also his family.
Finally, he realised that he had made a mistake and the people who used to work for him helped him. They rebuilt together a open-air circus.

Little by little we see how society rejects people like him. He notices all this and suffers a series of disgraces, which make his disease get worse, until the point of even killing people. He, becomes, at the same time, a symbol and leader of a revolution against aristocracy.

The last film I have watched is 'The King'. This film is the newest adaptation of Shakespeare's 'Henry V'. I found it quite slow when talking about the rhythm of the film. But the costumes, images and the actors are a very good representation of a medieval England. In general, I enjoyed watching this film but it is not one of my favorites. I think it has been more successful just because the main protagonists are well-known actors like Timothée Chalamet, Robert Pattinson or Lilly-Rose Depp.

I watched Harry Potter last week. It was the second film, where Harry meets Tom Riddle and he tried to kill him (like in the rest of the films). In the film Harry meets Dobby, who tries to warn him of the dangers of going to Hogwarts that year, as Voldemort is closer to him and is in better shape since their last encounter, where he was just a face attached to one of Harry’s professors. Many of Harry’s friends are petrified along the film, until Harry manages to open the Chamber of Secrets and fights the Obelisk. He kills the Obelisk, that happens to be one of Voldemort’s horcruxes. In the end, all of Harry’s friends are brought back to life and Harry is ready for another year of trying to be killed by Voldemort.

Last Friday, I was told to watch an Spanish film whose translation into English would be "Setback". Although I was not eager to watch it, as Spanish films do not tend to meet my expectations, I finally decided to give it a chance.
The cast was definetely amazing: Mario Casas, José Coronado, Bárbara Lennie... In fact, they all are definetely talented actors. Besides, the plot was so interesting and extremely addictive. It all starts when a couple (Adrián Doria and Laura Vidal, his lover), has an accident in the middle of a forest. They accidentally kill a boy, who was coming back home in that precise moment. Both of them start to panic, as they see how their lifes might dramatically change just because of a traffic accident which was not even their fault, since it was all provoked by a deer's jump. Laura decides to avoid phoning the police and solve the problem themselves. She asks Adrián to shed the cadaver and he obbeys her.
While Adrián looks for a place to get rid of the boy, Laura asks for help. A man who had been driving over there, finds her and invites her home in order to repair her car. She accepts and a succession of strange events, which I will not reveal so you can enjoy this amazing film, start happening from this point on.
At the beginning, the film seems not to have any sense at all, but it reminded me of a puzzle: every single detail is relevant and everything gains meaning.
Have you ever thought about your life? Have you ever considered destiny as a relevant factor in your life? All these questions and some others are answered in the film. Furthermore, it really made me reflect about how easy is to lose it all just because of small details. Every decision has its consequences, which can turn your life from a paradise to a hell.

It is about a family half Argentinian half Spanish that has to go through a tough time when the older daughter disappears during a family celebration. The main character, also, has some struggle dealing with a non solved sentimental situation with a friend of her past, who turns out to be the biological father of the missing girl. When he is told about this, he inmediately gets more and more involved and even gives all he has in order to save the girl.

The last film I have watched is called 'To all the boys I've loved before'. It is a Netflix film which is basically about a girl (Lara Jean) who has been writing secret love letters addressing boys from her high school. Her sister discovers the letters and sends them to the boys without telling Lara. When they read the letters, they seem to be very surprised and start to care about her. Moreover, she starts a fake relationship with one of the boys, just to show that she is not in love with the rest of them. In conclusion, I would say that although it is a predictable teen film, I found it very original and it also made me think about how young people express their emotions through writing.

The film is about an scottish policeman who has given up in almost every aspect of life except in his job. Due to several traumas such as the death of his brother and his divorce with his ex-wife, his mental state is in a very fragile shape which leads his pursue of greatness to fail miserably. Finally, it is revealed that the case he was covering was closely related to himself and, for that matter, he loses his job and commits suicide.

A movie that I have seen recently is "La meglio gioventú". It is an italian movie that displays the life of two brothers, Nicola and Matteo Carati. Nicola is a happy soul, always eager to open himself to others and aid them in what they need, he is a psychiatric doctor, Matteo is an introvert, at the start of the movie he intends to start a career studying literature, but meeting a young woman with mental problems will change the destiny of this two brothers. Matteo abruptly decides to change careers and join the military forces. The story cotinues, decade after decade showcasing the different paths that this two brothers, with their very different personalities, have to endure. It is a really charming movie that dwelves deeply into the psyche of their characters.

The Thirteen Roses (Las Trece Rosas) is a historical drama about the fight, imprisonment and later execution of thirteen republican women during the first year of the Spanish post-war period. After having won the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) Francisco Franco established a dictatorship, in which the first years were tremendously violent for those who didn't share his ideologies. Nevertheless none of these facts could discourage the thirteen roses, who fought for their beliefs until the very end of their lives.

Despite their young age - most of them were under-age, these women fought and worked secretly for the reinstatement of the Spanish Republic and against the dictatorship regime recently set up. They were therefore arrested and jailed and it is during the wait for their trial that they all meet. Meanwhile a macabre process of interrogation in which human rights are clearly attacked takes place. Moreover the vulnerability of life during these periods is clarified; one of the prosecuted is a fascist side defender but faces the same destiny after being caught hiding at her home a friend of hers, a sympathizer of the Republic.

The movie is a representation of one of the darkest chapters in Spanish history. It is a moving story that brings the onlooker to tears, feeling anger, impotence and hence making it impossible not to put themselves in the protagonists' shoes. In my opinion, a marvellous film.

Interestellar is an interesting movie about time travel and space adventures. It is not an easy task to explain it's argument, but the main concept being developed it's how humanity tries to save itself in a post-apocalyptic environment. In order to do so, they need to send a pilot to a black hole, hoping that he can jump on time and fix the situation that led to such a complicated scenario. The pilot chosen to do that task is a marine veteran now converted into a farmer, who lives with her father and his two daughters. At first, he is reluctant to go, but he finally accepts when he realizes that if the situation doesn't change they will starve anyway. While he is in space, time flows differently on earth, and he has to see how his children grow up without him and go through complicated times, which makes him go into a state of mind in which he can hardly differentiate reality from fiction. In the end, he manages to reunite with his daughter, who is now an old woman in the verge of death, while he is only a few years older than when he departed earth.

The Dark Tower: It shows the story of a young boy who's having very vivid dreams every night, about a post-apocalyptic world ruled by an evil sorcerer. Everyone thinks the boy is borderline insane, until he manages to travel to that world from a portal in an abandoned house. He meets some powerful allies on his way to defeat the villain and restore peace to the universe, but the sorcerer discovers about the boy, who's the chosen one, and tries to capture him with every tool at his disposal, even torturing and killing the boy's parents. Broken by sorrow, the boy relies on his most trustful ally, the last gunslinger, a fabled old group of heroes fighting evil since immemorial times, to guide him through the path leading to the sorcerer, seeking for revenge.

The last film I have seen is called "4L".
It is the story of two men who want to visit a friend who is living abroad and is ill. They know he has a daughter and they ask her to go with them. At the beginning she denies because she doesn't have a good relationship with her father but, after a while, she accepts but with a condition. They must travel in her father's car, an old "cuatro latas". The journey is a long one. They have to go to the south of Africa from Spain. They find lots of troubles in their way crossing the frontiers indifferent countries and travelling through the dessert.
In the end, after overcoming all the issues, they arrive to the father's home. He feels very excited and happy to see them but exhausted because of the illness. He is in bankruptcy and that is the reason why he couldn't travel back to Spain for a doctor. The friends and the daughter decided to start a new business with him in his town and live all together to help him.

Some weeks ago I saw a film about a child who was 12 years old. A new teacher of Social Sciences came to his school. The teacher asked the children to change the world. For that reason, this was a task for the children to complete along the whole year. However, the teacher didn't expected what the little boy was going to do.

This kid lived with his mother, who had alcohol problems. His father left them, but sometimes he returned. The boy hated when his father came home because he hit his mother.

Thinking about the task proposed by his teacher, the kid designed a method to change the world. It was like a chain of favours. Following this chain, you have to do something for three people, and these people have to do the same with another three, and so on and so forth.

Although thinking the boy's idea was brilliant, anyone expected it to really change the world. However, this chain of favours worked out pretty well and many people heard of it and participate. Thus, even the press wanted to know the origin of this movement of kindness, and a periodist found the boy. The periodist interviewed the child and he told everyone about his idea through television.

But this boy had a challenge. Several times he had seen how other children were hitting one of his friends and he could do nothing to help him because he was frightened. But one day, when he saw one of this scenes, he was brave and he tried to help his friend. Sadly, while fighting with one of the violent children, he was hurt by a knife. He end up in the hospital but nothing could be done to save his life. He was angel. His life was short but quite meaningful, since he changed many people's lives.

The last film that I have watched is the Joe Wright's version of Pride and Prejudice, filmed in 2005. I really enjoy watching this film since I am a huge fan of Jane Auten's novels and besides, Keira Knightley is one of my favourite actresses of all times.
When I try to explain the reasons behind my fanatism in relation to this film, I end up talking about the brilliant performance by the actors and the impressive scenery presented all through the film such as the magnificent landscapes in the Midlands.
Regarding the plot of the movie, we first encounter the Bennet family, a not that wealthy family that has enough incomes to sustain themselves. It is composed by Mr.Bennet, Mrs.Bennet and their five daughters. They live a normal life until the arrival of Mr.Bingley in the town. He comes along with the presence of his sister and Mr.Darcy. Althought in the beginning Mr.Darcy despises Elizabeth, he ends up falling in love with her and overcome their prejudices as they get married at the end of the novel.

The Strangers is an American horror film which I liked very much. I watched it with my cousin more than 7 years ago, when we were just kids. She was pretty much scared and I adored the film as it was quite interesting. It's about a couple who moved together to their own house. Suddenly, they start hearing weird noises from outside and inside the house. Some scenes show strangers disguised in creepy fancy dresses. They stared at the main characters of the film, then they tried to kill them. Finally, they succeeded in their duty and left the house. We can see at the end of the movie that they were mormons.

Titanic is a film directed by James Cameron and it was first screened in 1997. This film is set in 1912 when the real accident happened. There are two main characters who are Rose and Jack Dawson. Rose is a rich girl who travels in the ship with her mother and her fiancée while Jack is a poor man who gets the ticket for travelling in the Titanic due to his good luck playing pocker. When Rose is trying to kill herself Jack appears and convinces her not to do it. They fall in love but then a tragedy happens, the Titanic clashed with am iceberg and it started to sink. A lot of people dies including Jack who dies by the side of his lover. However, Rose survives and she is the one who tells the story 84 years later.

The last film I have seen is called "The Shining". It shows the story of a man , Jack Torrance, who starts working as a caretaker of an isolated hotel during the winter season. Things are ok until the moment in which he and his family start to experience a series of strange events, to the point of not distinguishing sanity from madness. Finally, Jack tries to kill his family. I really enjoyed this film because I love psychological terror.

The film I am going to talk about is called "Testament of Youth". It is a beautiful British production based on one of Vera Brittain's novels. Both the film and the novel share the same title, which may give some light about the content of the film.
As one can infer, "Testament of Youth" relates the experiences of a young girl who has to live the dramatic experience of a war. This young girl is called Vera Brittain and she is an independent, intelligent and advanced teenager whose thoughts are ahead of her time. She wants to study, go to college and become a writer. These ideas are not very well regarded by her paprents. One summer, she meets two of her brother's friends and they all begin a good friendship, sharing many moments together.
After getting parental approaval, Vera sits the college entrance exams and, although it does not go as well as it could, she gets a possition. During that period she sends and receives letters with one of his brother's friends, Ronald Leighton, with whom she starts a love relationship. However, later on that year, the First World War breaks and his brother and his two good friends enroll in the army.
She cannot stand the idea of having them fighting in the war while she is studying in Oxford. Thus, she decides to become a volunteer nurse. She starts attending injured soldiers in England when Ronald and she become engaged. They are about to get married when the chosen day a terrible call is received. Ronald has died on the battle fields. Later on, she attends her other friend, who has been seriously injured. Despite her many cares, he also died. Broken hearted, Vera decides to go to the nursing tents in the front as she cannnot stand the idea of remaining at home when her beloved brother and many other young men are fighting. She attends not only Brittish soldiers but also German enemies in their last minutes. One day, she finds out that one of the dying soldiers is her brother. After her many cares, he survives and comes back to the battel fields when he is totally recovered.
A bit later, while Vera is at home visiting her parents, a tragic letter arrives home. Her loved brother has died while fighting a few days before the end of the war is declared.
Broken inside, she comes back to Oxford and continues with her studies. One day, she attends a political meeting where she speaks out loud about her experiences in war and the need for peace in the world. This is the starting point of her future acions as a pacifist.

Papa, can you hear me sing? is the last film I saw in the subject Chinese thatre and Cinema. It tells the story of an orphan girl who is taken care by a humble man of a small Chinese village. He dedicates all his life and efforts to her. When she grows up, she turns out to be a great singer so a famous producer decides to make her a super star. However, fame is expensive and the producer obligates her to leave behind her past, oridins and even her name, changing it for a new and artistic one. She becomes really famous, loved by everyone and she seems to love all her fans except her family. At the end, her dearly dog that saved her life once, and her devoted father die. She wishes to have spent more time with the ones that deserve her time and realizes that fame would never be as important as love and family. The film makes a ponderation about the importance of knowing where you come from in order to know where you are going. Is it really worthy to forget about family just because of Fame? No, it isn't.

To Kill A Mockingbird: there are two kids in the story whose father is a lawyer. One of the kids is a 6-year-old girl called Scout and the other one is called Jem and he's 10. Their father gets a case to defend a black person, but he fails to prevent him from being convicted, declared guilty. This person is finally killed in prison. The children are very affected by this situation, since they have good hearts and know that the black person was actually innocent, so when the jury declared him guilty they felt that they didn't do justice. There is another plot line that is important in the story. The kids are interested in one of their neighbours who seems to be described as a mysterious and evil person, but they end up discovering that he is a good person and he even saves their lives. So we can say that both the black person and this neighbour are mockingbirds becasue they don't hurt anyone and are good people.

the last movie I saw was "to kill a mockingbird". It's about Tom Robison, a black man who has been falsely accused of raping a white girl. They go to trial and the jury finds him guilty despite all the evidences provided by his defendant, Atticus. Moreover, the title "to kill a mockingbird" is related to the character Tom because killing this kind of bird means to end with vulnerability and innocence, something that Tom showed during the whole trial. To sum up, the film shows how the black community was being persecuted in the 1930s in the United States.

column40: The most recent film I watched is Matrix. Mr. Anderson, the main character, seems to represent the typical office worker that wears grey clothes, lives on pre-cooked food and doesn't have much of a social life. In fact, he doesn't have a life at all. He embodies the realization that the so-called american dream is a rat trap, in which we all run inside a wheel day after day in order to make the system work, and believe we enjoy free will. That is actually both the introduction and the following 2-hour development. The actual plot is a dystopia set in 2199 in which the world has been completely destroyed after a war between men kind and artificial intelligence. Finally, robots took control of the world and now grow humans and connect them to a system that gathers their energy in order to feed themselves. Meanwhile, humans are unaware of their condition and believe to be living in 1999, which is actually a digital projection programmed by robots and introduced in the human brain through wires. I believe this is a metaphor of the afore-mentioned 'rat trap' and therefore a critical view towards our reality.

In the movie Joker, the main character (Jack) is a middle-aged man who develops mental issues and embodies the villain from the famous DC comic 'Batman'. Throughout the movie, he suffers from a severe reality dissociation  syndrome that makes him imagine situations that have not happened in real life as to the point he believes someone famous is his father. However, as the plot progresses, it becomes evident that his mental problems come from the abandonment and the abuse he suffered from early childhood. He starts out as an employee in an entertainment sort of company where he acts as a clown in several different situations. After a brutal beating, he starts developing further character issues and the funding for the therapy sessions he attends gets shut down. Some co-workers kick him out of the company by framing him with illegal gun possession. Right after that, he gets into trouble by killing some men in the subway that were trying to force a girl. This event becomes popular among society and some people start wearing clown-faced masks to protest against criminals. He also murders one of his co-workers and starts painting his face as a crazy clown character whose name is the Joker. From the beginning, he wanted to work as a comedian and after throwing various shows at different comedy clubs he gets asked to attend a famous TV show. In the TV show, he ends up killing the show's host on air and leading a violent street protest that triggers the death of Batman's parents.

I recently watched 'Titanic'. The plot centers on Rose's and Jack's love story aboard the Titanic. Both Jack and Rose fell in love at first sight; however, their story was not meant to exist: Rose was about to get married to a rich man, Carl, who would pay for all of her father's debts.

It was several days after the departure of the ship when they first met. One night, Rose was having dinner, and decided to leave the room and run towards the poop of the ship. She was tired of having good manners and behaving like a 'good girl'. She wanted to be herself, but the world wouldn't let her. This is the reason why she thought of jumping from the ship into the ocean and put an end to her suffering. However, Jack - who was in the exact same place - noticed what the girl was planning to do, and ran towards her in order to stop her from jumping. From that day onwards, Jack and Rose saw each other several times, until Rose's mother found out she was falling in love with Jack.

Rose's conversation with her mother brought her back to reality. She was about to get married, so she couldn't let her love story with Jack go any further. However, as Rose was sick of acting and pretending she was in love with Carl, she decided to go back with Jack. They kissed and made love, and promised that they would run away after the ship arrived in New York.

However, neither the Titanic nor Jack made it to America: the ship sank after hitting an iceberg, and Jack didn't survive. However, Rose survived and was rescued. She arrived in New York several days later, and after that, she began a new life. She married another man and had children. However, her heart never stopped loving Jack.

column40: Yesterday is a movie about a songwriter who struggles to make a living out of his music. One night, there is a blackout and he gets hit by a bus. The next morning, he discovers no one knows any of the Beatles’ songs. Up from till this point, he decides he is going to start singing these songs as if he was the writer. When he manages to achieve the success he had always dreamed of, he has to leave the love of his life behind. Finally, with the help of John Lennon, he decides to choose love over success and reveals the real truth.

One of the films I've watched recently is Fried Green Tomatoes. Despite what the title may indicate, it's not a film about chefs or anything like that. However, the name of the film has more to do with the main plot of the movie, since Idgie and Ruth, who are the protagonists, open a cafe whose main menu item is called like the title. As I've already mentioned, these two women are the focal point of the story, as they share a similar tragic background although they are completely different. While Ruth becomes a mother and gets married to an abusive man, Idgie refuses to settle and finds her own future without fitting standard gender roles. Although the storyline looks quite simple, the fact that it is narrated by an elderly lady called Ninny makes it more interesting as it creates a comparison between Idgie and Ruth's story and the current, more modern situation of Evelyn Couch, a mature wife who is really unhappy and tries to find her own self-confidence. Furthermore, the plot also involves the murder of Ruth's husband and the tragic death of Idgie's brother. In this sense. the film becomes the perfect field for a psicoanalitic study as well as a base for discussing gender roles, heteronormativity and even, racism. In general, I think this is a great movie since everytime you watch it, it gets better and you find out more about the underlying connections and metaphors that it entails.

Last weekend I watched 'Falling Inn Love', a Romantic comedy by Netflix. The protagonist is a very powerful woman in America whose company has just gone bankrupt. Moreover, her boyfriend is not at all interested in the commitment of living together after 5 years of relationship. She decides to break up with him, but she has a mental breakdown and starts drinking. While being drunk, she enters an Inn contest for winning an Inn in New Zealand, which she wins. She decides to fly from America to New Zealand and fulfill her dream of building a sustainably maintained house. When she arrives she finds out that the Inn she's won, has actually been abandoned for decades. Nevertheless, she's committed to making it work. In this tiny town she meets a guy (obviously), who's actually really handsome and knows how to reform houses and even has a business for it. At first she hates him because she thinks he pitties her, but little by little she starts to understand that in this town, everyone helps each other not because of pity but because they care for each other and are nice like that. So eventually they fall in love, reform the house and travel together throughout New Zealand. The ex-boyfriend actually tries to win her back but it's too late. Finally, even though in the beginning her plan was to reform the Inn and go back to her life in San Francisco, she falls in love with her life in New Zealand and decides to stay in the house of her dreams with the man of her dreams.

I have recently watched Marrowbone with some friends. The whole movie is about psychological issues but the audience doesn't know that until the very end. The protagonist is Jack, an eighteen-year-old guy. He, together with his mother and his siblings, moves to a house in the countryside. However, the mother dies soon and the four siblings stay in the house. From the very beginning the situation is weird, because Jack is obsessed with hiding all the mirrors and there is some secrecy regarding the father. Then, we discover that he was a murderer and went to prison, but he managed to escape. After the mother's death, the father showed up and apparently, the siblings locked him in the attic. But later on, the audience discovers this is not true. It was all product of Jack's imagination. The truth is that, when the father arrived, he killed his children in the attic. All of them except from Jack, who locked his father in the attic without food or drinks. However, the father did not die. After this, Jack went mad. He thought his brother and sister were still alive. He talked to them, he saw them, he played with them, etc. The characters of his siblings were actually ghosts produced by Jack's imagination. That is why he removed all the mirrors, because they demonstrated that his siblings were not real. One important thing is that the audience discovers the truth thanks to Jack's girlfriend, Allie. She gets his diary, reads it and finds out the truth. In that momento, she goes to the house looking for Jack but the father had escaped from the attic and tries to kill her. Jack recovers some common sense and finally kills his father to save her. At the end, Allie decides to stay with Jack. She becomes his wife and devotes her life to help him deal with his mental issues.

Contagion is the last movie I've watched. This movie is about an epidemic based on the real life flu which ends up spreading across the globe. The movie focuses on how the vaccine against this disease is developed as well as the factors which facilitate the contagion. It is also a critique on alternative medicine as the antagonist in the movie is a journalist who claims to have found the solution to this epidemic and anticipates that the vaccine will not be effective. Finally the pharmaceutical industry wins and the vaccine is proven to be successful.

Although I am not a big moviegoer, these past few weeks I have been watching a lot of movies. The last one was a horror film called "Annabelle". Even though I am not a big fan of horror movies, given that they are bad by nature, I had a grand time watching this film. It all started when I was going home after finishing my university lectures when some friends suggested that we could meet at somebody's house and have a movie night. After quite a long time deciding what to watch, we compromised and gave "Annabelle" a shot. The actual plot of the movie is nothing new: a happy family is tormented by a evil spirit. However, it is worth mentioning that the way it was executed was nothing less than brilliant. Instead of relying on jump-scares, the movie slowly builds up the tension from the very start. In fact, some friends were even closing their eyes at some points of the movie. Nonetheless, on a personal note, I must say that the movie should have been classified as a thriller more than a horror film since I did not find it really scary at all. I guess that even when movies are not that original or scary, the most important part of is the experience of watching it with a group of friends.

Last week I saw Taxi Driver by Martin Scorrese, it is one of my favourite movies and I watch it almost every year since I was twelve years old or so.
The main character is named Travis, who is a lovely man who suffers from insomnio and works as a taxi driver in New York. He is in love with Betsy, a girl who works at Charles Palantine's office, a senator who is winning for president. Although Betsy thinks that Travis is a weird man, she accepts to go on a date with him. However, Travis takes her to a pornographic movie theatre and the date turns into a complete disaster, Betsy feels insulted and doesn't want to hear of Travis anymore.
After Betsy's rejection, Travis gradually becomes a moniac and starts to think he is on a mission to "clean the streets" by eliminating all sort of animals. Travis considers himself a hero who must save the thirteen year old prostitute Iris from the hands of the man who exploits her, Sport. This obsessive crusade ends with Travis killin Sport and his young in a really violent climax. Taxi Driver shows perfectly the evolution of its protagonist's mind and his psychological conditions and also includes wonderful interpretations by Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster or Harvey Keitel.

One of the films that I have recently watched in the cinema was 'The Joker' (2019). This film is starred by Joaquin Phoenix, and it is one of the biggest blockbusters of this year. It provides a possible origin for the character appearing in Batman's saga. But this film goes way beyond focusing on Batman's movies, since it follows the life of Arthur Fleck, a man who suffers mental illness and tries to do stand-up comedy but fails in his attempt. I believe that this film is so important because it treats the issue of mental illness, and it gives visibility to this issue. During the film, the character complains about the fact that society tends to expect people suffering mental illnesses to behave as if they do not have it, and I agree with this quote.
Besides, when I saw this film, it reminded me of another film called 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest', which also deals with mental disorders.

The film I am going to talk about is Beauty and the Beast, which I saw recently at the cinema. The main characters were Emma Watson, one of my favorite actresses, and Dan Stevens, whom I already knew from Downton Abbey.
The story was based in the famous fairy tale in which a handsome prince is cursed by a witch because of his selfish and spolied attitude. He is transformed into a horrible beast and he is given an enchanted rose. The witch tells him that in order to break the spell he will need someone to love him with his new appearance.
Belle is just a girl from a small village who just wants to live adventures and travel around the world. When his father dissapears, she does not doubt an instant and runs away from home to find him.
She gets to the enchanted castle and becomes the beast's prisoner in exchange of her father's freedom.
At the begining, Belle is horrified by the beast's aspect, but then she begins to see something else inside him. After some difficulties related mainly to Belle's suitor, Gaston, the Beast finally earns Belle's love and the curse breaks turning the Beast into the prince he was before. They finally get married and begin a life together in the castle.

The most recent film I've seen is Parasite. It revolves around a poor korean family, they don't have a job and are having financial issues. The oldest son starts working as an english teacher for a high-class family and tricks the family into also hiring her sister, telling them she's just the friend of a friend who studied in the United States and has profound knowledge about children psychology and art. They also find the way to get rid of the rich family's driver and house assistant so their parents, camouflaged as strangers, can also work there. Everything seems to be going well but one night, the previous house assistant appears in the house and chaos ensues.

Last movie I've seen is "Maleficient: Mistress of Evil. It tells the story about how the relationship between Aurora and Maleficient herself has developed. Maleficient goes through different stages and feelings; still, she does not trust on humans, as a fairy (who had her wings cut off when she was little by them) she does not believe people could change. However, Aurora does trust on them and wants to marry a prince, decision Maleficient does not understand. Anyhow, Maleficient accepts the King's invitation to visit the village and the castle as everything he wants is a peaceful alliance between the Kingdom and the Woods. But, as expected, everything turned out pretty bad for Maleficient and all forest dwellers.

The last film I saw was the second part of Maleficent. In these films, the protagonist, which is kind of a magical creature, always has to fight against the humans that want to destroy her lands. The problem is that in this second part, her goddaughter is a human and wants to get married with the prince of the reign. Before the celebration, both Maleficent and her goddaughter are invited to the castle to have dinner. Once they are there the protagonist gets really furious remembering all the attacks she and her creatures have received in the past. In addition to this, the queen is constantly attacking her. Because of this, Maleficent leaves the castle, forbidding her goddaughter to get married. Then she leaves the city and find other creatures like her that help her in saving the lands and uniting both humans and creatures.

Last week I met with some friends to watch a film at my place. After some discussion we finally decided to watch Annabelle despite the fact that I am not keen on horror movies since I easily get scared and they always try to take advantage of that.
Regarding the plot, the only thing worth mentioning is that I wouldn't consider a creepy doll a good present, neither would I marry someone who is obsessed with collecting them. Moreover, this type of storyline is excessively overused and somewhat boring at this point. They have really dull, plane characters that do not ease the watching of the film for the spectator who is just hoping the doll would do anything other than stand there and exist.
Irony aside, I consider this production to be just another addition to the genre, not bringing a lot to the table in regards of the content and performance of the action. For the purpose of pure entertainment it could be good enough, but it is definitely not worth paying the money.

The day before yesterday I watched About Time with a friend. I must say this is a lovely movie, I completely recommend it. It’s about a guy who discovers he can time travel, and he uses his powers to conquer the love of his life. Sometimes he’s a little bit silly and doesn’t foresee the consequences to some of his travels, but overall it gets the viewer really involved with him and his life. I would also like to mention that this movie is not only about love, but is also about family, friendship and living your life the best way possible.

Jumanji' is a film about 4 High School kids, belonging to different social groups, who, having been sent to detention, encounter an old videogame (named as the movie). As they start it up, one by one are sucked inside the game, appearing in the middle of the jungle with the physical appearance and abilities of the avatar they had previously chosen. Their adventure then begins, challenging not only their integrity but their trust in each other, and even in themselves. They will have to flee from some situations, such as escaping from the hands of a gold-digger who'll do anything to recover a gem the group is to return to its original place in order to end with the curse that has sank the jungle in an obscure mood. Eventually, with the help of a fifth player, who has been years trapped in the game, they'll accomplish their mission, and go back home, as if not a single minute has gone away. The four of them, now with a bond that breaks through classes, discover that the older kid they found in the game, is now an adult with a family of its own.

The last film I saw is "Clerks" by Kevin Smith. It's an indepedent movie in "black and white". I enjoyed Clerks a lot, the screen-writing was excellent and very funny. The plot is simple: A young man named Dante works in a market, but he is not happy with his situation because he is too afraid to change to make any difference in his life, not only with his work, with his girlfriend, too. The interesting thing about this film is the conversations between the characters.
While I was watching this movie I was laughing so much that it hurted me.

Pitch Perfect 2 is the sequel to Pitch Perfect 1.  In this movie, the Bellas (an acapella group) have back to gain back the right to compete in the ICCA'S after having being suspended for "flashing" the President during a performance. This task turns out to be harder than expected when Beca (the leader of the group) gets an internship as a music producer and loses focus on helping her teammates. After many failed attemps at coming up with a good performance for the World Championships, Chloe the co-captain confrots Beca and turns to Aubrey (former captain) for help, who suggest a weekend of "Bella bonding", where Beca realises how selfish she's been. At the end, the Bellas win the competition and are allowed to continue competing in the up-coming years.

Last week I watched a film called “Everything is illuminated”. I actually really liked this movie and I found it really inspiring because it was so creative that it made me want to create my own stories. The main character was a young American jew called Jonathan whose grandparents came to America from Ukraine because of World War II. The young man goes to Ukraine to try to find the woman who helped his now deceased grandfather escape from the nazis. There he meets an old man and his grandson called Alex who are the owners and only employees of a company that helps people find their ancestors. Alex becomes the other main character because of his big personality and the continuous cultural shocks between him and Jonathan give the movie a humorous touch. The big reveal is that the Ukrainian old man, Alex’s grandfather, is in fact also a jew and he was connected with the woman that helped Jonathan’s grandfather escape the nazis because her sister helped him as well. The movie ends with the old man’s suicide and his family giving him a jewish funeral in homage of all those years of hiding.
I think this is now one of my favourite films because it talks about something political and let’s you know about horrible things that actually happened but the director also knew how to give the story a humorous touch with surrealist moments and the help of the previously commented cultural shocks. I think this film is worth watching.

In the end, Maleficent recovers her wings and the king dies as an indirect effect of his own paranoia and bitterness.

"Call me by your Name" is a film by an Italian director. At first, I had no intention of watching the film, since the drama genre is not what I really enjoy. However, after being aware of all the positive criticism and how inspiring it was for some of my colleagues and close friends, I decided (and I don't regret) to watch it. Indeed it makes you see the theme of love in a different way from what we are used to. Thought-provoking plot and stunning interpretation by its lead actor, a teenager who falls in homosexual love with an intern student that his father has brought home for the summer holidays. Uncertainty, passion and how natural love in any of its occurrences is are the engine of the film.

The last movie I watched is called Tune in for Love. It is a Korean movie recently released that follows the relationship of a man and a woman through the years. The man has a problematic background, for which he has been locked in a juvenile institution for six months and released for good conduct. This has stigmatised him forever and he finds it difficult to find a job, until he meets the protagonist. This young woman works at a bakery and offers him a part-time job that gives him the opportunity to start a new life.
Through the following years they continually lose contact and find each other again, and the friendship they had built is damaged as time passes and they don't communicate. When they finally find each other working in the same company, they start a romantic relationship that is also full of challenges. They eventually overcome those challenges and learn to be together in spite of their differences.

One of my favorite films is called Un cuento chino. It tells the story of an Argentinian middle-aged men who leads a very isolated life working in an appliance store. He basically rejects human contact due to trauma. If I remember correctly, his mother died when he was very young. In his teens he had a huge quarrel with his father and, right after that, he decides to enlist himself in the army to participate as a soldier in the War of Las Malvinas. His father was so disappointed in him, since he himself had feed from Italy to escape from war. While the protagonist is abroad, his father dies, so he never had a chance to reconcile with his father. After many years spent in isolation, a Chinese immigrant appears on the scene. He's lost and vulnerable, so the protagonist is forced to get out of his shell to help this man. It's a very sweet comedy. I do recommend it.

This is the story of a young woman who lives with her old father. One day her father gets lost in the woods and ends up in a castle where he is kidnapped by a hideaous beast. This beast is in fact a prince who was transformed into a monster by a spell cast by a princess. The story goes that the spell will be broken if the beast learns to love another human and earns her love in return. Belle, the young girl, is horrified by the beast at the beginning but as the days pass she falls in love with him. Things get complicated by another male character, Gaston, who is in love with Belle. When the Beast and Belle are about to live their love, Gaston attempts to kill the beast but he dies when he falls from a tower. Finally, Belle tells the Beast that she is is in love with him and the spell is broken.
